Got @pasta ğŸğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‘Œ Back in Italy again after last week - can't stay away ğŸ™ In Bologna for the long Easter weekend - the ancient capital of the Emilia-Romagna region - and home to many Italian food staples we all know and love. I headed out of the city today with lovely Max from @amazingitalytourswithus, visiting a Parmegiano Reggiano production site, checking out how Prosciutto di Modena is made, and sampling traditional balsamic vinegar of Modena, aged for 30 years ğŸ˜ Splurged on a bottle too, and a big hunk of 36 month old cheese for home ğŸ’™ Also visited Maranello, the home of Ferrari ğŸš—ğŸ’¨ğŸ’¨ Learnt heaps - check out my Instagram Stories for the behind the scenes.

Listen up friends: some of the best Turkish food I've had in London canÂ be found @skewdkitchen. LOOK at this beautiful spread ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡·ğŸ’™Â They have one guy whose job it is just to bake the bread (6 different types ğŸ˜), their fish is from Billingsgate, they have the same meat supplier as Hawksmoor, they make absolutely everything from scratch (except the ice cream - I'll let that slide ğŸ˜…), and Exec Chef Maz recently won 'Chef of the Year' at the British Kebab Awards. Continuing with my #BeyondZone1 series, this place might be in Cockfosters (last stop on the Piccadilly line, for realzÂ ğŸ˜±), but it is categorically a must visit if you like Turkish food.
